item.title: KBR 获得美国国家航空航天局价值高达 36 亿美元的宇航员健康支持合同
item.description: 工程承包商 KBR 公司周三表示，它已从美国国家航空航天局（National Aeronautics and Space Administration）获得一份价值 24.6 亿美元的合同，以支持宇航员和工人在执行太空任务期间的健康与安全。【原文：Engineering contractor KBR said on Wednesday it had secured a $2.46 billion contract from the National Aeronautics and Space Administration to support astronaut and worker health and safety during space missions.】

item.title: 交易日 现在美联储唯一的疑问就是降息 25 或 50 个基点吗？
item.description: 交易日【原文：TRADING DAY】

item.title: 美联储主席古尔斯比发出秋季降息的信号
item.description: 芝加哥联邦储备银行行长奥斯坦-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）周三表示，他对关税不会推高通胀感到不安，也不相信美国劳动力市场正在恶化。【原文：Chicago Federal Reserve Bank President Austan Goolsbee said on Wednesday he is uneasy assuming that tariffs will not push up inflation and is unconvinced that the U.S. labor market is deteriorating.】

item.title: 金融科技公司 dLocal 增长超预期，上调 2025 年指导计划
item.description: 乌拉圭金融科技公司 dLocal 周三上调了对 2025 年的预测，预计其收入和利润增长幅度将更高，此前在巴西和墨西哥的稳健业绩帮助下，该公司的盈利飙升，超过了分析师的预测。【原文：Uruguayan fintech dLocal on Wednesday raised its forecasts for 2025, predicting higher ranges for its revenue and profit growth, after earnings surged ahead of analyst forecasts helped by solid results in Brazil and Mexico.】

item.title: 谷歌将斥资 90 亿美元在俄克拉荷马州扩建人工智能和云基础设施
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司周三表示，未来两年将在俄克拉荷马州增资 90 亿美元，用于扩建云计算和人工智能基础设施。【原文：Alphabet's Google said on Wednesday it will spend an additional $9 billion in Oklahoma over the next two years to expand cloud and artificial intelligence infrastructure.】

item.title: 思科预计需求增加，季度收入高于预期
item.description: 思科系统公司（Cisco Systems）周三预计第一季度营收将高于华尔街预期，原因是人工智能的蓬勃发展促进了云计算客户对其网络设备的需求。【原文：Cisco Systems forecast first-quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, as the artificial intelligence boom boosted demand for its networking equipment from cloud customers.】

item.title: 花旗在北美招聘私人信贷银行家，在欧洲招聘技术银行家
item.description: 花旗集团本周招聘了两名高级投资银行家，扩大了其银行业务负责人 Viswas Raghavan 的招聘活动。【原文：Citigroup hired two senior investment bankers this week, extending a recruitment drive by its head of banking, Viswas Raghavan.】

item.title: 独家新闻消息人士称，特朗普计划对阿拉斯加州征收关税，美国很可能几周后就会对制药业征收关税
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府宣布对药品进口的调查结果和美国对特定行业征收新关税的时间可能还有几周，四位官员和行业消息人士说，这比他最初承诺的时间要晚，因为他正专注于其他事务。【原文：The announcement by President Donald Trump's administration of the results of a probe into pharmaceutical imports and new sector-specific U.S. tariffs likely remains weeks away, four official and industry sources said, later than initially promised as he focuses on other matters.】

item.title: 博斯蒂克称，美联储可以等待调整政策，因为就业市场已接近充分就业
item.description: 亚特兰大联储主席拉斐尔-博斯蒂克（Raphael Bostic）周三表示，美国就业市场保持在接近充分就业的水平，这为央行提供了 "奢侈 "的条件，使其能够避免匆忙做出任何政策调整。【原文：Atlanta Federal Reserve President Raphael Bostic on Wednesday said a U.S. job market holding near full employment offers the central bank the "luxury" of being able to avoid rushing to make any policy adjustments.】

item.title: 美国宣布为关键矿产和材料部门提供 10 亿美元资金
item.description: 美国能源部在周三的一份声明中表示，特朗普政府将提供 10 亿美元资金，用于加快美国关键矿产和材料行业的发展。【原文：The Trump administration will make available $1 billion in funding to accelerate the growth of the U.S. critical minerals and materials sectors, the Energy Department said in a statement on Wednesday.】

item.title: 企业公司德克萨斯州 Seaway 输油管道原油流量下降，并有泄漏报告
item.description: 四名消息人士称，德克萨斯州 Seaway 输油管道的原油流量周三有所下降，因为该输油管道的运营商向州监管机构报告系统发生泄漏。【原文：Crude oil flows on the Seaway pipeline in Texas fell on Wednesday, four sources said, as the pipeline's operator reported a leak on the system to state regulators.】

item.title: 古尔斯比：美联储在考虑利率决策时正努力应对关税的影响
item.description: 芝加哥联储主席奥斯汀-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）周三表示，美国央行正在努力了解关税是否会暂时或更持久地推高通胀，这将为其决定何时降息提供参考。【原文：Chicago Federal Reserve President Austan Goolsbee said on Wednesday the U.S. central bank is grappling with understanding whether tariffs will push up inflation just temporarily or more persistently, which would inform its decision on when to cut interest rates.】

item.title: 美国最繁忙海港负责人称，美国集装箱进口量可能在 7 月份达到顶峰
item.description: 周三，美国最繁忙的海港的高层管理人员表示，在零售商竞相从中国和其他国家进口商品，以避免可能对假日相关产品征收的巨额关税之后，美国的海运进口量可能在七月份达到了顶峰。【原文：Ocean imports to the United States may have peaked in July after retailers raced to bring in goods from China and elsewhere to avoid potentially hefty tariffs on holiday-related products, the top executive from the busiest U.S. seaport said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 由于 Coach 手袋吸引了年轻购物者，Tapestry 季度收入可能增长 5.5
item.description: 与传统奢侈品牌相比，Tapestry 的时尚手袋价格更为亲民，市场对其需求不断增长，因此 4-6 月份 Tapestry 的销售继续保持强劲势头，收入可能增长 5.5%。【原文：Tapestry kept up a brisk pace of sales in the April-June quarter, with revenue likely growing 5.5%, thanks to growing demand for its stylish handbags that are more affordable than traditional luxury labels.】

item.title: 会议纪要：加拿大央行对关税对货币政策的影响存在分歧
item.description: 作者：Promit Mukherjee 和 David Ljunggren【原文：By Promit Mukherjee and David Ljunggren】

item.title: 消息人士称，Trafigura从LME仓库提取锌，部分用于运往美国
item.description: 五位熟悉内情的消息人士称，大宗商品交易商 Trafigura 正在将大量储存在伦敦金属交易所批准的新加坡仓库中的锌运往美国。【原文：Commodity trader Trafigura is taking large amounts of zinc stored in London Metal Exchange approved warehouses in Singapore and shipping some of it to the United States, five sources familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 沃尔玛扩大员工 10% 折扣范围，将大多数食品杂货纳入其中
item.description: 沃尔玛首席人事官周三在一封信中告诉员工，沃尔玛将在今年内把员工 10% 的折扣扩大到几乎所有的食品杂货，包括乳制品和肉类。【原文：Walmart is expanding its 10% employee discount to nearly all of its grocery items, including dairy and meat, through the year, the company's chief people officer told its staff in a letter on Wednesday.】

item.title: Mediobanca 称下周投票需要投资者做出选择
item.description: Mediobanca 周三为其提前到下周就竞购 Generali 银行作出股东决定的举动进行了辩护，称投资者需要提前投票，以便为该银行选择最佳方案。【原文：Mediobanca defended on Wednesday its move to bring forward to next week a shareholder decision on its bid for Banca Generali , saying that an early vote was needed for investors to pick the best option for the bank.】

item.title: 巴西为受美国关税打击的出口商推出一揽子援助计划
item.description: 巴西政府周三公布了一项期待已久的援助计划，以帮助因美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对来自巴西的许多商品征收高额关税而受到损害的企业。【原文：Brazil's government unveiled on Wednesday a long-awaited aid package for companies hurt by steep tariffs imposed by U.S. President Donald Trump on many goods from that country.】

item.title: 高盛经济学家不惧特朗普攻击，计划 "一如既往 "地工作
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普因高盛研究团队估计美国消费者将首当其冲地承担特朗普关税的成本而抨击这家华尔街公司及其首席执行官，高盛的一位高级经济学家周三表示，没有计划改变其团队开展和发布研究的方式。【原文：A top economist for Goldman Sachs on Wednesday signaled no plans to change how his team conducts and publishes its research after President Donald Trump lashed out at the Wall Street firm and its chief executive because of the research team's estimate that American consumers would bear the brunt of the costs of Trump's tariffs.】

item.title: 纽约起诉 Zelle，称安全漏洞导致 "猖獗 "的消费者欺诈行为
item.description: 纽约州总检察长莱蒂西亚-詹姆斯（Letitia James）周三起诉 Zelle，称该电子支付平台拒绝采用关键的安全功能，导致欺诈者从消费者那里窃取了超过 10 亿美元。【原文：Zelle was sued on Wednesday by New York Attorney General Letitia James, who said the electronic payment platform's refusal to adopt critical safety features enabled fraudsters to steal more than $1 billion from consumers.】

item.title: CoinDesk 所有者 Bullish 表示首日开盘股价将比 IPO 价格高出近 62
item.description: 加密货币交易所运营商 Bullish 的股价在周三的开盘价比首次公开招股价高出近 62%，这表明投资者对该行业的信心不断增强，同时也提振了其他数字资产公司未来在美国上市的前景。【原文：Shares of cryptocurrency exchange operator Bullish were indicated to open nearly 62% above their IPO on Wednesday, signaling growing investor confidence in the sector and boosting prospects for future U.S. listings by other digital asset firms.】

item.title: 挪威间谍头目指责俄罗斯黑客在四月破坏大坝
item.description: 北欧国家反情报机构负责人周三表示，俄罗斯黑客今年早些时候曾短暂控制了挪威的一座大坝，这是奥斯陆首次正式将网络攻击归咎于邻国。【原文：Russian hackers briefly took control of a dam in Norway earlier this year, the head of the Nordic country's counter-intelligence agency said on Wednesday, the first time Oslo has officially attributed the cyberattack to its neighbour.】

item.title: 在通胀数据和贝森特的评论之后，美联储降息几成定局
item.description: 在新数据显示美国 7 月份通胀以温和的速度增长，以及财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）表示，鉴于近期就业数据疲软，他认为美联储有可能在 9 月份积极降息半个百分点之后，美联储在 9 月份降息的可能性已接近 100%。【原文：The likelihood of a Federal Reserve rate cut in September is now seen near 100% after new data showed U.S. inflation increasing at a moderate pace in July and Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said he thought an aggressive half-point cut was possible given recent weak employment numbers.】

item.title: Comcast 在世界杯前首次推出以足球为主题的视频套餐
item.description: 互联网和媒体巨头康卡斯特公司（Comcast）周三专门为其 Xfinity 客户推出了以足球为主题的视频套餐，希望在包括 2026 年国际足联世界杯在内的重大赛事之前吸引体育迷。【原文：Internet and media giant Comcast launched a soccer-focused video package exclusively for its Xfinity customers on Wednesday, as it looks to attract sports fans ahead of major events, including the 2026 FIFA World Cup.】

item.title: 印度 Infosys 公司将以 1.53 亿美元收购澳洲电信公司 75% 的股份
item.description: 印度 IT 服务公司 Infosys 周三表示，将以 2.333 亿澳元（1.53 亿美元）的价格收购澳大利亚 Telstra 集团旗下 Versent 集团 75% 的股份。【原文：Indian IT services company Infosys said on Wednesday it would buy a 75% stake in Versent Group, a unit of Australia's Telstra Group , for A$233.3 million ($153 million).】

item.title: 印度中央银行委员会建议金融业采用人工智能框架
item.description: 根据周三发布的一份报告，印度储备银行的一个委员会建议制定一个框架，为印度金融业发展人工智能能力，同时防范相关风险。【原文：A Reserve Bank of India committee has recommended a framework for developing AI capabilities for the country's financial sector, while safeguarding it against associated risks, according to a report released on Wednesday.】

item.title: 瑞士认为关税有可能增加美国 F-35A 战斗机的成本
item.description: 瑞士政府周三表示，尽管部分由于美国关税的影响，采购总成本尚不明确，但瑞士仍将致力于从美国购买洛克希德-马丁公司的F-35A "闪电II "战斗机。【原文：Switzerland remains committed to buying Lockheed Martin F-35A Lightning II fighter jets from the United States despite an unclear total cost of procurement in part due to the impact of U.S. tariffs, the government said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 国际文传电讯社称，俄罗斯开始限制 Telegram 和 WhatsApp 的部分通话功能
item.description: 俄罗斯 Interfax 通讯社周三援引俄罗斯通信监管机构 Roskomnadzor 的消息称，俄罗斯当局正在采取措施限制 Telegram 和 Meta Platforms 旗下消息应用 WhatsApp 的部分通话。【原文：Russian authorities are taking measures to restrict some calls on Telegram and WhatsApp, the messaging app owned by Meta Platforms , Russia's Interfax news agency cited Russia's communications regulator Roskomnadzor as saying on Wednesday.】

item.title: 亚马逊将当日杂货配送扩展至易腐食品，与 Instacart 和沃尔玛展开竞争
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com）周三宣布，亚马逊 Prime 服务的用户现在可以在订购草莓、牛奶、肉类和冷冻晚餐的当天收到这些食品，因为该公司将快速配送服务扩展到易腐食品。【原文：Subscribers to Amazon.com's Prime service can now receive strawberries, milk, meats and frozen dinners on the same day they order them as the company expands its fast-delivery option to perishable food items, Amazon announced on Wednesday.】
